title: Installation issue: tau@2.30.1%gcc@7.1.0
body:
I have to profile some software packages like superlu-dist with tau using a  x86_64 GNU/Linux cluster . I installed spack using this command:
git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git.  The command for tau installation is :

> spack install tau@2.30.1%gcc@7.1.0+fortran+mpi+openmp+papi+pdt+pthreads


The compiler I should use is  gcc@7.1.0. The installation gives error with tau building stage:
 

> ld: fatal error: cannot use --plugin: ld was compiled without plugin support
>  312    collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
>  313    make[1]: *** [tau_convert] Error 1
> 

I tried to add -fno-use-linker-plugin to gcc@7.1.0 compiler flags but that does not help.  The specifications of the compiler from is like this

> - compiler:
    paths:
      cc: /x/progs/gcc/GCC-7.1.0/bin/gcc
      cxx: /x/progs/gcc/GCC-7.1.0/bin/g++
      f77: /x/progs/gcc/GCC-7.1.0/bin/gfortran
      fc: /x/progs/gcc/GCC-7.1.0/bin/gfortran
    operating_system: centos7
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags:
      cflags: -fuse-linker-plugin
      cxxflags: -fuse-linker-plugin
      cppflags: -fuse-linker-plugin
      ldflags: -fuse-linker-plugin
    spec: gcc@7.1.0

The output result, the spack-build-env and the spack-build-out are attached.  Using a different compiler like gcc@8.3.0 and gcc@10.2.0 even gives the same error.

Any idea is highly appreciated.
